oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sam Davis, Confederate Boy Hero bust
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Bust of Sam Davis. Caption below reads: "Sam Davis, the Confederate boy hero who suffered death by hanging, as a spy, rather than betray the confidence of one who gave him the papers, found on his person, though he was offered his liberty, as the price for this information."

Sam Davis (1842-1863), known as the Confederate Boy Hero, was a Confederate soldier and spy who was captured by Union secret service agents and imprisoned at Pulaski. Davis was hung after refusing to betray the source of the documents about the Union were concealed on him.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Davis, Sam, 1842-1863
Soldiers; Spies; Sculpture
